alert.note: Alert for Camden; Laclede; Miller; Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 12 at 11:26PM CDT until July 13 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Miller County in central Missouri... Northeastern Laclede County in southwestern Missouri... Western Pulaski County in central Missouri... Southeastern Camden County in central Missouri... * Until 1215 AM CDT. * At 1126 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles east of Camdenton, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Northwestern Fort Leonard Wood, Lake of The Ozarks, Lake of The Ozarks State Park, Ha Ha Tonka State Park, Waynesville, Osage Beach, St. Robert, Richland, Crocker, Iberia, Linn Creek, Stoutland, Brumley, Ulman, Freedom, Kaiser, Laquey, Swedeborg, Decaturville and Ozark Springs. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 142 and 160. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
